text: In telecommunication, a toll switching trunk or toll connecting trunkThe Digital Future, 1979 Toll connecting trunk is a trunk connecting one or more end offices to a toll center as the first stage of concentration for intertoll or long distance traffic. Operator assistance or participation may be an optional function. In U.S. common carrier telephony service, a toll center designated Class 4C is an office where assistance in completing incoming calls is provided in addition to other traffic; a toll center designated Class 4P is an office where operators handle only outbound calls, or where switching is performed without operator assistance. == References == * ==See also== * Class-4 telephone switch Category:Communication circuits Category:Telecommunications economics
title: Toll switching trunk
